raw_text:
Roddick in talks over new coach
 
 Andy Roddick is reportedly close to confirming US Davis Cup assistant Dean Goldfine as his new coach.
 
 Roddick ended his 18-month partnership with Brad Gilbert on Monday, and Goldfine admits talks have taken place. "We had a really good conversation and we're on the same page in terms of what I expect from a player in commitment and what he wants," said Goldfine. "The reading I got from him is that I would have a lot of the qualities he's looking for in a coach." Speaking to told South Florida's Sun-Sentinel newspaper, Goldfine added: "That being said, from his standpoint, which is smart, he wants to cover all his bases. "I think Andy wants a long-term relationship and wants to make sure it's the right fit... the best fit." Goldfine, 39, has worked with Todd Martin and Roddick's close friend Mardy Fish, and was an assistant coach with the US Olympic team. Martin is the other name to have been linked to the vacant post alongside Roddick.

llama3.2:3b: Andy Roddick is close to confirming US Davis Cup assistant Dean Goldfine as his new coach, ending a 18-month partnership with Brad Gilbert.

Roddick wants a long-term relationship and is ensuring he has the right fit for him.  Martin is also being considered for the role alongside Roddick.

Goldfine has discussed terms and agrees on expectations from a player, including commitment and qualities needed in a coach. At 39, he has coached Todd Martin, Mardy Fish, and the US Olympic team. Other names linked to the vacancy include Martin.

Goldfine said he had talks, they're on the same page, and he's looking for a good fit as a coach. He mentioned Mardy Fish has also been linked to this spot alongside Roddick. He emphasized that Roddick wants a long-term relationship and a perfect fit.

</think>

Andy Roddick is considering a new role as US Davis Cup assistant coach, named Todd Goldfine, in a 12-month period. He has ended his previous 18-month contract with Brad Gilbert and is now on talks with him. Goldfine shared that he had discussions with Roddick, indicating he's committed to finding the right fit for the coaching position. Mentioned are Mardy Fish as another potential coach linked to this role. Roddick emphasizes a long-term relationship, looking for both personal and organizational success.
tinyllama:1.1b: Andy Roddick has reportedly finalized his coaching selection by hiring Brad Gilbert's long-time assistant Dean Goldfine as his new coach, according to a report from South Florida newspaper Sun-Sentinel on Monday. The talks have taken place between Roddick and Goldfine, and the former Davis Cup assistant admits he has learned that Goldfine wants to cover all aspects of his coaching career. Despite discussing his qualities with Goldfine, Roddick is reportedly intent on making sure it's the right fit for both parties before finalizing the decision.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Andy Roddick and Brad Gilbert parted ways following their US Davis Cup partnership in June, as both athletes were eager to seek new opportunities and prioritize their personal interests. However, according to sources close to the situation, Andrew "Roddie" Roddick is now considering a new coach for his upcoming tenure with the US Davis Cup team, with Brad Gilbert's former assistant Dean Goldfine reportedly leading the charge.

Andy has been in discussions with Goldfine regarding a potential partnership as his coach, and it seems like he's confident that this arrangement will be successful for both himself and his team. In Goldfine's own words, "I think Andy wants a long-term relationship and wants to make sure it's the right fit... the best fit." Furthermore, Goldfine has also expressed his admiration for Roddick's commitment and qualities as an athlete, asserting that he would have a lot of the qualities he seeks in a coach.

The selection process for a new US Davis Cup coach will undoubtedly be intriguing, given the fact that both Brad Gilbert and Andy Roddick had previously been linked to the role. While no official announcement has been made, with both athletes eager to move forward with their careers, it's clear that there are some strong candidates vying for the coveted position of coach.

Goldfine has worked with Todd Martin in the past and was an assistant coach for US Olympic Team. He wants to ensure that he has a long-term relationship with Roddick and is seeking the right fit.
